column5: Hello everyone Happy New Year Well I have decided to get my hunting Licence next week , and I was woundering if anyone would recommend a good gun store with allot of knowledge, I live in Guelph and I don't mind driving anywhere as long as the service is good, I will be looking at shotguns probably with interchangable barrels, one for  bird and one for deer.
The best guy I know is Sam at Carra Outdoors in Belleville. You will never be disappointed.  http://www.carraoutdoors.com/
I would firmly second Roy's recommendation.  Sam is a great guy!  G

http://www.lanzshootingsupplies.com/ Lanz is right on the silverdale gun range so you can site it in right there. St Annes/Smithville.  Also Erie Tracker in Port C. They're popular because they have good service.  I thought one of the biggest gun movers was a store in your area Kitchener I believe.  Hey don't buy cheap. get something recommended. I bought the mossberg 500 combo and I'm not very happy with the shot pattern or noise of the pump mechanism. Should have listened and spent another $150 bucks.

locally for Guelph I would recommend Shooters Choice Kitchener and Fishing World Hamilton. SC has a website which they do list the used firearms.  Last time I was out at Gagnon in Oshawa, they had a good selection of used shotguns.

I get most of my firearms/ammo from gagnons. They have an online gun shop on thier website.  You can't go wrong with a Remington 870 combo for a shotgun set up. I wouldn't trade mine for any other shotty!! She justs keeps on going!  Sinker
You'll save a bundle $$$ buying used. Get a Semi-auto Winchester for a duck gun. Get an English stock for a Grouse gun. Get a Bow for deer.
Google: Ontario hunting forums. Then search their classifieds.  http://www.ontariotrophybucks.com/

How I gun shop:  If im impressed with the stores customer service, and they made time for me, even if its busy... sale.  If they try to rush things, dont value you as a customer, dont know what their talking about, or dont seem convincing... hmmm ill have to come back next week. aka SIR.

my stevens 200 (made by savage) 22-250 shoots under 1" groups at 100 yards and its only $300 brand new.  as to buying the actual GUNS (bet you cant have just one) id visit any gun shop to find what you like and then order from SIR/cabelas or wholesale sports. even with shipping you will save quite a bit of money most the time. if you arent concerned about saving $$$, support the little guys.  for your first shotgun, id get an 870 express super mag combo. comes with a 26" smooth bore and a 20" fully rifled barrel to shoot sabots. mine has been through hell and hasnt let me down yet. it also shoots 2 1/2" groups at 125 yards   and can be had for under $600. buy a weaver side mount so you cant use a scope with the slugs to get the guns full potential.
Yeah,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Just hope one comes by. Hanging head low.  Give Carl or Gary a call at the wolfsden.
